text:
@MonicaHone @sammi_cook_ @markwilkinson1 @Feargal_Sharkey @RosieP4 @EnvAgency @AnglianWater Doesn't matter the region the response from the EA Is the same
We came
We didn't see anything 
Water tested normal
Case closed
RT @scottdegg: @StinkStopthe @AaronBell4NUL @SimonTagg @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids @JamesBevanEA Staggering... out of control, the crisis…

💨So the wind direction swings around again and the south & west of the Borough get the brunt of the stink this evening. The operator is now halfway to @EnvAgencyMids deadline to reduce the odours without any success. What is the EA’s plan B? @StinkStopthe @AaronBell4NUL https://t.co/5Ssb90uU4h

urls.title: Japan to Announce Fukushima Water Release Into Sea Soon
urls.description: The Japanese government has decided to dispose of massive amounts of treated but still radioactive water stored in tanks at the wrecked Fukushima nuclear plant by releasing it into the Pacific Ocean, local media say, a conclusion widely expected but delayed for years amid protests and safety concerns.
